question: To Princeton University's Director of Admissions For my mother, that afternoon eleven years ago was a watershed not because of my father's There was never any pretense that the gorgeous, vital, clever, temperamental animal that was my mother ever for a heartbeat considered having any life of her own. She ignored all her needs and was alive only for me. It was terrific. At the time.
answer: Hi. The girl and woman are enormously excited over this word even though, outside, her life's mate is being loaded into the back of a police car. It seems the mother will save her child the trauma of her father being carted off; but the police turn on their siren and the girl turns to see her father as the car pulls away. The child is stricken. A tear starts to form in her eye. Her mother acts quickly. We are about to see powerful emotion reversed by sheer force of will..the mother leans down, gives three quick kisses - power pecks - to the girl's cheeks and then an admonition in Spanish.

question: "One tear..only one...so make it a good one." This was my mother's instruction to me. My mother dealt with our considerable problems of survival by talking..Always she discovered her own best thoughts by sifting through her own words. The mother stops talking in mid-sentence, realizing she has just solved something and makes a note. Each night my mother promised me a wonderful life.. Each night I looked for a new expressive way to tell my mother how much I loved her. The child is ardent..clutching at her heart...kissing her mother.. Holding her mother's face, talking directly into her eyes. The mother, enormously pleased, is nonetheless thrown by the extremes of it. I just played and did my lessons and every time I looked up my mother was in the process of saving us. Desperation in her hands was our weapon. With this weapon she had her marriage annulled - usually impossible for the poor - and somehow convinced an associate of my father's to transport two Mexicans North in style.
answer: Hi. How are you? I am fine.. ..happy, merry, joyful, glad, contented, frisky. As they taxi.

question: My mother's prayer for us, which she made me repeat exactly, represented a stunning look into our future. "Please God, let only the bad things change." My mother had redefined her own passions. Blaming herself for the father she gave me, she would never again be lured by a man's rough edges..She had decided that goodness would be her catnip.
answer: Texas... The mother hurries her along in the direction of distant lights. Texas. Mam, Texas.. She raises her fingers like pistols. Shoots, blows in them and reholsters them. Adios, Texas.

question: Here, take these. Was that strange to give you money..I just felt badly that..
answer: It's okay. She pockets the cash. She is my niece. She and her daughter live in the apartment I manage. Yolanda, who worked for you, lived there before she went back home. That's how I heard about the job.

question: So who am I interviewing?
answer: Her.

question: You're gorgeous. On our gal..as she, not understanding the word, smiles and nods.
answer: Vistosos. Our gal thrown. Not knowing how now to react.

question: What's your name? Llamo? One of my five Spanish words.. Flor. She pronounces it flat like the "floor" we walk on...throughout the following each of the women sticks to their pronunciation as indicated by the extra "r's.
answer: Florrrrr.

question: Flor.
answer: Florrrrr.

question: Flor.
answer: Florrrrr.

question: Flor.
answer: Florrrrr.

question: Flor..what I walk on?
answer: Florrrrr.

question: Welcome to the family.. Deborah kisses her..sort of on the mouth. In the midst of Flor's delight she is thrown by Deborah's kiss...it is the first of many borders to be violated.
answer: I brought some dessert. As he moves on, we see in the background the workers unwrap and react to a fantastic concoction. A caterer falls in beside him and whispers to him.

question: We can do it. Come on. She falls over the roll..getting filthy..but it gives and they gain momentum...one of the catering women falling down, one losing pace.. Deborah,however, gains the upper hand. Yet, even while succeeding, she remonstrates herself. Why... do... I... care.. so.. much.. about.... CRAP? And now she wins.. the cylinder of grass rolls all the way out and she jumps on the seam in victory. She is dirty, spent and triumphant..the components for a solid sexual experience..and, in truth, as the exhausted caterers half- heartedly applaud the bizarre victory, she has gotten off. She looks with mother's pride at the lawn. Then sees John. Can you believe they left without finishing? As she looks at her handiwork - John looks at her..A grin..half laugh.. He loves the dame. Looks great, huh?.... You're not looking.
answer: I was getting a kick looking at you look at it. Not the answer she wanted..

question: I better get dressed again in case anybody's just a half hour late. She hits a switch at the door and the backyard area is now fully illuminated -- set up for a dinner party for 20 or so....all details thought about and done to a "T". This is the outdoor lighting nobody nails..the twinkling of a half acre..the path to the pool like a runway to heaven. As she looks at it all she has a wistful moment. Okay..We're okay here. Why can't everything be like sod? There's no wait, no dung, nothing you have to do right and yet it's perfect. It covers up all your dirt and makes things immediately pretty..then, the miracle, if you just give it time, it roots and you can't tell it from the real thing. No reaction. Nothing to say.
answer: Huh? Oh sure..I, uh..Well, no, I don't have anything particular to say.

question: Oh, John why don't you just take out a knife and kill me all together. Somewhat crushed, she prepares to exit.
answer: How'd you get there..Hey, wait a minute..Deb..stop..come on. I'd like to figure this one out. What would have been the great thing for me to say after you said the sod sentence?..Really.

question: That's actually a good question.
answer: There you go. I surprise sometimes.

question: I would have liked, if after I compared the sod to life, if you had said, "Exactly!" She turns to leave.
answer: Yeah. But to say that and mean it I'd have to think the same way you do.

question: Okay...think SERIOUSLY about getting up. You don't have to get up yet but are you thinking seriously about it?
answer: Yes.

question: Okay.
answer: Now?

question: Yes..actual up.. Georgie gets up..
answer: Morning, Dad.

question: Yeah, good morning.
answer: You as mad at me as Mom 'cause of what happened? John pauses..aware his answer will have repercussions but integrity wins.

question: No, Georgie, I'm not.
answer: Are you mad at me?

question: Try some. She demurs. Bernice holds out one slice on a spatula, indicating Flor should just tear a piece off which she does...One taste and she marvels -- her mouth dropping open at this kid's ability to make something mundane special..Bernice laughs. Thanks. Her mother enters on her way upstairs. She is thoughtful, tense and sweaty - her run having failed to exorcise her current demon. She greets Flor and then shakes her head, making a vain attempt to communicate her troubled mood to Flor in some sort of sisterhood based on life being a fucker.
answer: Tough day. Bernice prepares a plate for her mom while, in the b.g., a GOLDEN RETRIEVER named CHUM approaches Flor from behind with a ball in its mouth. Flor is checking out the kitchen... what's in each drawer, etc .....Deborah is impressed by the self-starter display and indicates same to Bernice.

question: I had an idea for a breakthrough in French toast so I made breakfast. I don't want to be teased about it.. No sarcasm. No tough love. Just try it and if by any chance you have a positive reaction...
answer: Right..mean ol' me. I can't play right now. I have to do something about your brother.

question: I had an idea for a recipe. When has that happened? I got up early to do this. At least taste it, for God's sakes! She does..
answer: Oh, it's good...oh God, it's rich -- Oh God, it's good. By the way, you could do without this. The approval rug pulled out from under her, Bernice looks at her mother. But Deborah is unaware of having hurt her daughter because her attention has been diverted so that Deborah AND THE CAMERA LOSE FOCUS ON BERNICE as the teenager, distraught, moves from the room. NO..NO! FLOR!....Never do fetch. Chum is nudging Flor with the ball and Flor was about to accommodate him by taking it before Deborah's warning shout stopped her in mid-sentence. I mean it, NEVER! ON Flor's stunned reaction to the outburst. I'm not mad. I'm thinking of you. This is me being nice.. Then using her hands to demonstrate. Just no taking ball from dog. Trust me on that one. CLOSE UP ON Chum going nuts with Deborah's hand passing in front of his face ignoring how urgently he offers the ball. You and me. We are fine. Just a tip. Girlfriends. Could you make some coffee? Cafe?

question: This isn't an argument, honey.
answer: Yes. Yes it is. So stop being so maniacally calm.

question: No..it's not. Because I understand your side.
answer: I can't be wrong about that too. This is a fight. We're having a fight. Yo, I feel anger. Deborah turns from the sink revealing one brown eye and one blue. She blinks, realizes one lens is not in and turns back to the sink. Can I have a moment? John exits into the.. Okay..Let's get someplace here. You, mister, are crazy making..I can't take this calm thing you've started doing. It's like this is your way of letting me know there's something deeply wrong with me because I'm not calm.

question: Let's not go all over the place..Can't we...
answer: If you're going to talk to me please have the decency to raise your voice.

question: Let's make a break for it.
answer: What are you talking about? He signals her with his eyes and head and then takes a large but tentative step away from the spot where he was standing...then additional faster steps. He gestures with enormous energy for her to follow him to his new spot in the room. She eyes him suspiciously.

question: Just for a second. She walks to him...he puts an arm around her shoulder. And gestures back to where they were standing. He talks in an almost hushed, conspiratorial voice. We don't have to be those people. Nobody's watching. They've been masquerading as us for a while here..I'll distract them - you make a break for it and I'll meet you outside.
answer: You're ridiculing me because I care about this.

question: No. I'm not. I mean this..let's get away from those two in case they're as miserable as they look.. Come on, baby. He is looking at her with wit and conviction..trying to squirt lighter fluid at the flame of their love. Deborah looks up at him..intimacy of a different sort.
answer: Let me ask you a question..let me change the subject..Forget for a moment that you won't support me with Georgie..

question: Well, I don't think... She makes a noise of frustration to stop him..It works. John is rendered still and intimidated by her conduct but he is "man" enough for his jaw to set...to pause for a beat as he looks her straight in the eye..And walks back to the spot they occupied previously. Go ahead.
answer: Here's the question. It's been on my mind more and more. Do you do that calm thing for the purpose of infuriating me?

question: What? Why would ... Why would anyone do something to someone they love for the purpose of messing them up?
answer: Okay. He hates that look of isolation on her face..He needs to make her feel better.

question: Deb, since high school we've been able to read each other...take advantage of it..The answer to the question is,"absolutely not." Now take a look and tell me if you believe me.
answer: I don't.. believe you. I think you just want me to feel badly about myself..Sorry, honey.

question: Great God in heaven save me. Boy meets girl.
answer: Hi. He turns with a start to see Flor smiling at him. Gorgeous squared. His first word is inadvertent.

question: Whoa...whoa...I didn't know Deborah had found someone... You work here? You're going to help with the house and kids?
answer: Solo espaol.

question: Sorry...
answer: Not the best place to stand, fella.

question: No. It's me. You're the new helper, huh.. No..no..it's okay. It's me being bugged. Two people head for John almost simultaneously. PEG, an arty looking woman in her late 50's..wild, scraggly gray hair, enters lugging an ice chest and the maitre d'. Knockout. You want to learn something? You want to pack it away? The kid nods.. he picks up the fish. Cradle it...Put it in the cooler but not on its side.. In the same position it swims. And check the ice pack..make sure it can drain away..if it can't the chlorine can hurt the flesh. Do all that and nobody can put a fish in the fridge better than you...and that's a solid start.. First day and you already did something perfect. Oh, sorry..I forgot. He whispers in John's ear.. Damn.. "ohhhh damn."
answer: What, buddy, what?

question: Victor spotted a food critic..
answer: From?

question: This is going to work.
answer: I don't know anything.

question: Free your mind...the president whose policies many consider responsible for the Great Depression...
answer: I don't know...

question: Name a vacuum cleaner..
answer: Okay. Yes..thanks.

question: And this vacuum whooshed all this money out of everyone's pockets.
answer: Got it. I no longer know nothing.

question: And Hoover was followed in office by..
answer: I'm just drawing blanks. I'm embarrassed. It's my own fault I spent my time on math, which I'm lucky if I don't flunk anyway and..

question: The guy we are looking for is not a ruse..
answer: What's ruse mean?

question: Phony. So this president was not a ruse..He was the real thing. Ruse??
answer: Rusevelt..If I'd ever heard of the word before - that would lock it in..It's so stupid it might work anyway... Deborah enters followed by Flor. They are carrying several boxes of clothes...

question: Rusevelt..If I'd ever heard of the word before - that would lock it in..It's so stupid it might work anyway... Deborah enters followed by Flor. They are carrying several boxes of clothes...
answer: Surprise new clothes.. Bernie gasps..As she looks at a sweater..

question: What'd I do right?
answer: Warehouse sale.. Bernice tries on the sweater over her T-shirt..and mirth ends..The sweater is tight...Bernice picks up a blouse and then skirt and checks the size.

question: Thanks, mom..I'm glad you didn't get here a little earlier or else I wouldn't be able to tell you that your gift is a ruse. Please, excuse me.. She exits to her bathroom.
answer: She's right between the two sizes..I thought about it..what am I supposed to do encourage her...what is it? - DENIAL? Or motivate her to get herself in shape. Flor tries to slide by..Something surreptitious in her behavior..Deborah suddenly turns to Flor. Flor.. She holds out her hand in a "we women understand" gesture. Flor does not waver..just meets her eyes.

question: Hey..buenas dias, Flor.. Flor holds up the new clothes and indicates that they are beautiful. Yes..Well, taste she has.. Bernie starts her morning routine..her back to us when:
answer: Just try it on.

question: Hey!!!! When did you learn to...
answer: Just try it on..

question: Too tight..it doesn't fit. Flor clearly doesn't understand..
answer: Just try it on..Hey?! Flor extends a blouse and skirt. Just..

question: Okay. I'll show you.. She steps behind a closet door to try the clothes on, muttering pessimistically before she does so. CAMERA STAYS ON Lovely way to start the day. World's most trim Mexican learns her first sentence and uses it to watch me grrrrunt my way into... And then....silence...Bernie, open mouthed, steps out wearing the clothes which fit like a glove. Flor beams..then laughs at Bernie's reaction as she keeps checking the waist and looks into the mirror.
answer: Lo siento. No. Chum, momentarily depressed, walks away..Bernie enters. She is a bit overwhelmed -- her voice breaking a bit even with one word.

question: You don't even know how important the trade is..
answer: Let me just do Georgie.... Here. He hands her the newspaper...

question: He says he'll give me any three silvers for him.
answer: I don't know...This is the one you started with..You really want to give up your first card? Note

question: I know..that's why I needed you.
answer: ..this is your favorite..

question: I think he'd go higher.
answer: But it's not numbers..it's..... They are interrupted by a never quite heard before sound of exultation.. For God's sake..why did you...

question: Oh, damn it --- what am I going to do? Everything seems so surely pointless...
answer: Hey, Deb?

question: Yeah? He scoots to her side.
answer: You know, I guess I got used to you getting a little blue after intercourse...But DURING..??

question: Something else I do wrong. She grabs something and starts walking toward the bedroom.
answer: You've gotta stop walking away.

question: If I stay, I will say awful things to you that I might not even mean..You pick.
answer: See ya. She exits to the bathroom.

question: Should I stop answering? We're booked for two months solid.
answer: No, no, no, no, no....I want to keep some walk-in business..I want this to stay neighborhood.

question: Impossible. There would be riots..You should hear the desperation in their voices..Best day of my life.
answer: We'll serve a full menu at the bar then.

question: Then where do I put the people waiting for a table? It won't work.
answer: Do this for me.

question: There's no way.
answer: Do this for me or I'll set my hair on fire and start punching myself in the face.

question: Huh?
answer: Yeah..you're right...that was an unusual way for me to make myself understood..But you'll do the bar thing?

question: I need to talk to you.
answer: Ah, man..Okay. They walk into the cooling room. What's up? What's wrong?

question: I've gotten a fantastic offer for my own place..Everybody wants to back me since the paper came out.
answer: What's your reaction?

question: Honestly? Because I've had this very unusual reaction.
answer: Yeah.

question: I've had a hard on almost all day and it won't go away. Like I'm riding on the back seat of a bus with bad shocks and every other passenger is a gorgeous woman with a yellow sports top whose leaning over. It's like every dream I ever had and some even I didn't have the balls to dream..
answer: So you're considering taking it?... Okay, here's the thing. I can't lose you and still keep the hours I'm keeping. I can't do my life unless I can hold onto you. I think I just gave you an incredible bargaining position.

question: So you're considering taking it?... Okay, here's the thing. I can't lose you and still keep the hours I'm keeping. I can't do my life unless I can hold onto you. I think I just gave you an incredible bargaining position.
answer: So you gave away twenty percent of the restaurant without talking to me about it.

question: Yeah. If I didn't do it - I'd have been coming home just to sleep.
answer: Remember the other day when you asked me the perfect response to something I said?...I'm asking you now..what would you like my response to be to your giving away twenty percent of the business without asking me?

question: "You're ma man!"
answer: Okay! So that would be???

question: My dream response from you, yes.
answer: I'm not quite there..Actually, I just had this flash that the reason women in the old days used to faint was to avoid doing acts of violence against men. And I was all worried about figuring out the timing just to talk to you about renting a place for the summer.

question: Well, I think you got your timing.
answer: Be right out... Mom, you want to come?..the realtor's here..Okay, see you later. She clicks the gate open and walks to the man..perfect 40 year old great looking surfer sort..Deborah does the very slightest of "takes" at his looks..As she gets in.. Hi. I'll never be one of those girls whose hair blows perfectly in a convertible. Oh, you must be trouble. On his small laugh... Gorgeous, huh..Pretty, fabulous, beautiful. What word is the same in Spanish?

question: Thanks. I don't care if it's a rental..this place is getting a fixing. She leads Flor to a small bedroom. This will be yours.. Flor doesn't understand..certainly doesn't want to.
answer: Did you ask her if she could live in?

question: Come on...there's no buses from her to here. There's no question. Double come on... Deborah uses her hand as if weighing something momentous like the law vs. the bible then with heavy sarcasm. The Barrio - Carbon Beach..The Barrio - Carbon Beach. What to do? Don't worry. I'm putting nicer stuff in here too. When Flor gives no indication of anything - just standing, somewhat stupefied..Deborah takes her by the hand and leads her out. You must learn English. Why won't she learn English? I'm going to have to learn, "you must learn English," in Spanish.
answer: I think Flor is perfect and we should do all we can to keep her from changing.

question: Gee, you took the words right out of my mouthay. Oh, good. Do you speak English?
answer: Yes, I do.

question: Would you translate for me? He looks at Flor..my God.
answer: Sure...forever. He speaks to her in Spanish..a lavish, poetic compliment. Flor, in full control, says, in Spanish.."Would you please just find out what she wants." Evelyn joins them.

question: You want to go swimming?
answer: Oh yeah, you're off.

question: What do you think, wet suits?
answer: Wet suits are for wimps..

question: Yeah, you're right..let me get mine.. Georgie laughs..
answer: You're good.

question: My mother says it's best if we get out of the way and put our things away.
answer: Have you ever been to the beach here?

question: I've never been anyplace but Mexico and Texas.....before today. John goes to a big toy box and opens it up..it is filled with beach paddles, Frisbees and boogie boards.
answer: Here's the most important place in the house..grab this stuff whenever you want.

question: Right. Settle in..
answer: Thank you. I am thrilled to be here.

question: Hey, Cristina...hey...hey..What are you doing up? Cristina looks around -- then up..
answer: Oh, hi..so beautiful..I was just excited.

question: I know..Would you believe I had to talk my husband into this? Would you believe I had to talk my husband into it?...do you hear me?
answer: Yes...I just .. I didn't know what to say?

question: Do you want to come with me? -- I'm going to the flea market.
answer: I don't know what that...

question: It's the Rose Bowl... miles, actual miles, of great things for sale for God's sake...We can have brunch in Pasadena.
answer: I don't want to wake my mother so early.

question: With great energy born of bottled fury, Flor begins to go through her daughter's things...finding her backpack and extracting a Spanish/English dictionary. Stop thanking me. I love having the company.
answer: It was an adventure which I'll remember.

question: Your English is genius. Do you dream in Spanish or English?
answer: Just recently I've had a dream in English.

question: What was it?
answer: I am so sorry. I -- uh..I'd ..I uh, can't tell ..This is so uncomfortable.

question: You could have just said you didn't remember.
answer: I, uh, guess so..but I do.

question: From? Flor with enormous emphasis stabs her finger at her own chest. You are not yourself...This was written in anger. You sleep on it and then if you still want me to have it -- fine..I don't think you will once calm and rational thought returns. Just sleep on it. Deborah exits to a bathroom and closes the door...leaving Flor in the hall with the letter..Cristina reveals herself and explains the situation to her mother. The last word we hear before scene's end is "maana."
answer: She didn't even want us to know she had a daughter - then, on the first day, you take the kid without asking. I think that's...

question: What!?! Insensitive? Elitist? Irresponsible? Perverse? Dizzy?
answer: Dumb. She looks at him...He has been atypical...Her immediate emotional cocktail is panic, fury and deep, deep hurt. Her words are slow...her voice ragged...

question: Come on, Cristina - go get em. Her eyes widen and off she runs, intoxicated with being included and having the chance to make money. Hi..what's doing? She overturns a large bucket and a small mountain of sea glass spills on the table. I'm broke.
answer: No..you don't have to pay..I'm sorry. Don't worry, please.

question: No. I'm kidding..Instead of a platter -- I'll just build a sea glass building and serve fish inside... Great, Cristina..Why don't you count it and..
answer: I have... Many times..I didn't sleep. I counted.

question: So what's the damage...total? Her eyes locked on his.
answer: It depends on whether you consider these four a color other than green, brown or clear.. She takes them from her pocket.

question: Well, this one is borderline.
answer: I agree.

question: Oh my God, you found a blue..Nobody finds a blue..You know how a blue happens? I mean, before the ocean blasts it for 30-40 years. Somebody had to throw away an old Milk of Magnesia bottle. You know what Milk of Magnesia is?
answer: Unfortunately. He smiles broadly. The kid's a trip. He likes her.

question: So how much for the whole deal?
answer: Eleven hundred and one dollar. He reacts..then..

question: May I talk to you?
answer: You mean your mother.... Cristina nods...not comfortable breaking the rule of only speaking for her mother...She faces him, her back to Flor. Sure you can talk to me.. Cristina begins translating as her mother speaks in Spanish..

question: I don't have to sleep first?
answer: What's wrong? Flor waves the money..Cristina waves an empty hand as she speaks for her mother.

question: Did you give this money to my daughter?
answer: I made this little deal..with all the kids to...

question: Please.. Flor advances on him past her daughter so Cristina now translates from the background. You don't tell or ask the mother when you give a child a fortune for looking on the beach for stones..what is the word for this..
answer: Sea glass? On hearing the translation of "sea glass" an exasperated Flor turns so that her back is to John as Cristina admonishes him.

question: Smug. John gets up and takes a conciliatory step toward Flor so that now Cristina is in the middle looking up at them as she translates for John
answer: I had no idea it would amount to that kind of money..I thought --- sort of tops fifty dollars.

question: Fifty dollars is a lot of money..
answer: Okay. Right. He has no idea where to take it from here -- the two females look as he searches for the right thing to say.. Ah, shit.. That fast Cristina translates.. Before Flor can react. John talks directly to Flor..quiet,compassionate, a bit beaten. I'm sorry....I get why you are upset. It might not look it but I am good at getting things. Doing something about it is something else..I was going to talk to you before I actually gave her the money..but maybe I should have checked before I started the whole thing. I know what it's like when you feel your kid is being messed with..I get the message. It won't happen again. It's late..I'm sure we'd all like... Flor lets it out...her daughter hard pressed to keep up.

question: To what..sleep? If this was small enough to be helped by some little apology, I would be a fool to bring it up..I need to say more no matter what the result. I need to be impolite. You leave someone else's child alone. It's simple, no? It is too easy for children to feel contradictions..It encourages questioning their parents..and that makes them less safe. Your wife takes her for rides and changes her hair..You give her money. Here.. Take back the money???????????? Flor hands John the envelope under her daughter's wrenching gaze. They begin to exit..but Flor turns inadvertently bumping into her daughter. Her voice softens. I did not mean to be angry to you - only emotional.. They turn to leave. John speaks with sudden volume and muscle.
answer: What about hypocritical? Cristina turns back..confused..her mother asks her for a translation and she complies.. Flor then wearing the same confused expression. Yeah, you heard me. It's not like you didn't do the same thing...

question: No difference. I interfered.
answer: Okay......I'm still not sure I did the right thing keeping it to myself. It felt disloyal to Deborah..but my daughter really needed someone to be kind to her right then..so..so.

question: I am very embarrassed. You are very right. Hypocrisy..yes.
answer: I'll tell you, it's pretty wild to say something and have the other person just concede the point. I'm dazed here.

question: I will leave whenever it is good for you and...
answer: No..no..come on, man..

question: But how can I work for you after we talk like this?
answer: You can't quit even if you want to and you know why.

question: Hey, boy, I can use some up company. But Chum feverishly digs his snout against a nearby piece of furniture and retrieves a tennis ball and rockets away. John follows, weaving a bit. You gotta do something about Chum..Your arm's going to go. She waves it off and hurries to get her tape and get out of his way. Chum complicates the task, proffering the ball. Flor wearily throws it. Don't you sleep anymore?
answer: No..You get more if you keep at it.

question: You're doing fantastic.
answer: Now I am like a three year-old. Your wife go out.

question: She say where?
answer: No. Sorry.

question: How'd you get your mother to let you go with my mother?
answer: Well, your mother just said she could use my help on a few errands while you're in class... Bernice nods. Then unconsciously moans. What?

question: No. Just that I hate summer school.
answer: Why do you go then?

question: I'm not sure I can explain to you the concept of not doing well in a class..in this case math...and the system kind of insists on the illusion that you've learned math -- so they make you go to summer school..It helps them avoid facing that they have failed in their mission.
answer: What do you mean they failed?

question: Joking.
answer: Oh. I see. Forgive me, I don't have a real sense of humor.

question: Thank you, God. Joking...
answer: The joke is?

question: Nuh-uh, Flor you are not pinning this one on me. I've got to finish packing up.
answer: I just don't....Out of space this school wants her to go for free?

question: We ran into the school head. They want diversity...Cristina knocked her out...I had nothing to do with it. By the way, the scholarship is worth twenty thousand dollars. And early registration is tomorrow.
answer: It is too far from our home.

question: You could move in with us in town.
answer: Never, thank you...

question: May I talk with you?
answer: Me? Deborah will be home soon. I just talked to her.

question: I need real talk..Is it okay? John does not answer immediately. The brief pause is noted. No?
answer: Sure.

question: Outside? Private?
answer: Sure..... You have me a little worried... He glances back, hoping to have his fears assuaged, they are not.

question: You know about Cristina and your great school?
answer: Oh, it's happened. Is it driving you nuts?

question: Yes, nuts. I have no idea what to do. Such an important thing.
answer: Yeah.

question: It's a good school?
answer: Tops. It's tops.

question: So you like it?
answer: No. I hate the damn school. But that's because they keep sending my daughter home anxiety-ridden, mostly over geometry..I mean you "get" Bernice..In a decent world her school should let her know how great she is, right?

question: Very right.
answer: So, don't ask me..I'm worried about my own kid there.

question: You don't have to worry about Bernice. Nothing is going to change that heart. He looks at her..Out of nowhere overwhelmed by someone echoing and affirming his deepest most private thoughts about his daughter..It is odd..being this deeply touched before he knows what hit him..He makes little adjustments until the moment passes..
answer: Um.....yeah..thanks... It's great to hear someone else say that out loud..Hard to explain.

question: I "get" it.
answer: Ah, man..

question: It will be okay.
answer: No, I was thinking about you..

question: Your, "Ah, man" was for me? You think I am in trouble with Cristina?
answer: It's just tough to be sane.

question: ....I never know a man who can put himself in my place like you do. How do you become that man?
answer: I don't know...You introduce two Jews in the desert and wait five thousand years. Then, bingo, somebody else who can see trouble coming but can't do anything about it.

question: I don't understand.
answer: That's okay.

question: I want to.
answer: Nothing. I don't know what I'm talking about.. A sustained gust of wind which celebrates her shape in a way which cannot be ignored. Will you sit down.. Get out of the damn wind. She sits. It helps. So you going to send her?

question: I don't know. But it does not feel good. I think if she goes there it will be one of two things..either she will be odd...or she will make herself the same as them.
answer: That is EXACTLY the way I felt about Bernice going there..Exactly.

question: Yes, you gotta. Camera begins to pull back...early in the move John's words stop the movement.
answer: This was a crummy summer. Flor nods ruefully..then suddenly off a glance at him.

question: Not all crummy. Suddenly there is a bit of danger..she rises quickly, changing mode. Thank you, good night. I go sleep.
answer: Good night..Hey? She turns.. You speaking English...It's, uh..

question: What?
answer: Nothing. Just.... Nice meeting you. She gulps and exits...as the CAMERA PULLS BACK..ending the summer at the rented house...as we transition to....

question: Wait! Deborah turns, startled. I need to talk to you privately, honey.
answer: "Honey?"-- Can't now, Mom...I'm late..I was looking all over for you...keep an eye on the kids. You know my secret cell number.

question: Just give me a moment to talk here..
answer: What is it? Are you buzzed?

question: No. I gave up drinking weeks ago. Yes. Nobody noticed -- which shows I probably conducted myself pretty well as a drunk. But duty called and I'm sober so may I say just one thing.
answer: One thing..go ahead...

question: Thanks..Deborah, you're going to lose your husband and you'll never find someone as good. There will only be men who you know are cheap and shallow and have no real warmth in their souls. You may have gotten by on those surfaces once but now you've been spoiled by a good man and you can no longer glide on such thin ice. If you do not act quickly you will soon cement an awful fate for yourself. A life, with no hope of repair, which has already begun to turn desperate and dumb. That's it. Drive safely. She grabs a deep breath and then turns and walks to the house. If we're out of coffee, it's over for me. Suddenly a sharp horn is heard..Evelyn jumps..then turns to see her daughter calling to her from the driver's seat of the
answer: You've done it again, Mom, made me hate myself..One of the things I can count on..

question: Deb..Deb?..where are you? He is about to leave the room...she is about to let him but an instinct leads her astray once more.
answer: Here I am.

question: Baby, what?
answer: "Baby?" Stay there, John...Sit down..I suddenly get what I have to do...I just have to get the guts.

question: Is it absolutely necessary to make it this...this scary..can you just say it?
answer: Not so easy.

question: Yeah..come on..it's me. We can talk.
answer: Do I ever hope so...I've been seeing another man for the last eleven weeks and it was nothing and I ended it tonight..At first it was just keeping an eye on the real estate market..Then it was...what? Me being insecure and looking for some ridiculous vali...

question: Go -- hold on...hold on...I'm missing what you're saying..You can't just keep talking and expect me to follow it when you start the way you did.......
answer: Just what did you hear?

question: Well there was the crack in the planet. That was noisy... She looks at him...a solid beat... There's an actual noise in my head.....no kidding.. Briefly he does the noise...
answer: I met him about... John holds up a hand to stop her...he needs to gather himself to hear this..She waits...and waits...as he waits he grows flushed and stunned with dread. Finally a word..

question: You.. She takes that as a cue to start..
answer: I met him.. He puts up his hand..

question: If you talk that fast...I'll never hear you..there's a lot going through my mind....Have you said yet whether you slept with him?
answer: So far I've just been talking about a flirtation because the really important thing for you to know...

question: Have you said yet whether you've had sex with someone else? Because I really am missing most of your words. So help me out here..
answer: I've been trying to explain that for the first ten weeks there was almost nothing to ...

question: You still haven't said, right?
answer: Is this your way of...

question: This is my way of...this is my way of asking you whether.. He stops... staggering on the threshold of a diminished future. Oh man, once I ask it...give me a second. I'm just trying to figure out whether there's any way to avoid knowing..no, damn There's not... Okay, you're on..real short answer, huh? Have you had sex with another..
answer: I know you're very angry?

question: Ahhhh...I'm getting there, yes.
answer: John? I think if you let me tell you the full everything of this we'd be in a position to deal with it better..because eleven weeks ago when...

question: You don't believe that I miss your words..I get three or four tops...and then just see your mouth moving with nothing coming out and then I spin out and there's this noise...But there's no way to miss a "yes" or "no."
answer: Yes..

question: Really?
answer: I made up my mind that I would answer every question you had..I'll answer anything and everything and more.

question: What other questions could there be?
answer: Are you really that much nicer than me?

question: Well, you don't set the bar real high. He get up and starts to exit..
answer: No. Please, please, please..I think if you listen to exactly what happened and then do whatever you need to...we'll..just let me tell you everything.. The doorbell rings...it's quite late...Deborah wondering what's up..she looks out the window. Oh, it's just Flor.

question: ...then, when I was driving back tonight after I ended the whole yuck thing..I was feeling human. I'm done with what's his name..a relief... ..and now it can be like it never happened and then I thought that the only hope was that I own that it did happen and that I take my medicine here..because if I'm walking around with what I did and you don't know what I did..there is a real limit to how close we can be..you're with me and I'm this person who has this bad secret and we aren't really on the same page ever again..so the reason I took this chance in telling -- is because I want us to be good..I want us to be close. I want to feel like you're not nuts to be in love with me..So what I think is we should talk till we pass out .. Talk till we're so sick of each other that there's nothing left to do but take the first step out of hell..So please let's not leave this room until you've heard and said everything..please say, okay.. She awaits his answer..He has heard barely a few words..
answer: What?

question: John..
answer: I've got to get out of here..because you keep talking. Stay put! She does. Just before he exits.

question: You've got to say something.
answer: You are a terrible wife. He exits.

question: Where you going?
answer: I'm leaving....I have finally..

question: Me too..I'll drive you.
answer: No.

question: Yes..come on...it's past midnight here.
answer: If you truly don't know why I say "no" let me at last say the reason. At least that will be a relief. Have you no idea that I....

question: Look I have to get out of here right now..
answer: Go.. John exits to driveway...Flor makes one last toss..these tosses have not made a dent in her anger and frustration. Goodbye, Chum. Another toss and Flor follows John out the door.

question: I'm taking you.
answer: Why?!?

question: Because if I don't -- I'll worry about you and I can't handle that right now, okay? Flor emits a crooning sound.
answer: Ahhhhh. I never made that sound over a man before.. Please!?! Mandiln. Arrchhhhhyeeeeiii! For John, the first clear thing he has heard in a while..

question: Yes! Exactly! Well put! Teach me that word sometime. I can really use it. She nods..there is almost a moment of relaxation..then the anger fires an immediate need..She leans across the seat to deliver an urgent message to him. The words come out exponentially too forcefully.
answer: I quit this job! His spontaneous and forceful reaction surprises her..

question: I quit this job!!!!! As he turns onto Sunset.
answer: That's the bus stop.

question: I'll take you home.
answer: No. Drop me at a bus.

question: Oh, shut up and stop telling me what to do.
answer: Okay...then let's do something besides driving me home where my daughter isn't.

question: Okay..we'll do something.
answer: And I'm supposed to figure out what because I'm a housekeeper and you don't have to think.

question: Oh, don't do the class thing, man..You don't know where I come from.
answer: Alright, I know. But I can't be responsible no more for making sure nothing happens. That's another terrible job I quit.

question: What are you talking about? I take responsibility for anything within a block. You have nothing to worry about. That's my job.
answer: Excellent. So you're going to figure out what we do, right?

question: Yes. Okay. Big man figure out!
answer: Stop there. She points to a mall..He looks at her and pulls in. Maquillaje! This is me when I'm not working.. You have never seen me!

question: Well, you look familiar.
answer: So, "man," where we heading?

question: I don't think I can handle public..
answer: Yes, no...lots of people right now is..

question: I know.
answer: You were going to figure this out!

question: My place!
answer: I've never seen your place. Very perfect. He heads for the kitchen.

question: I'm going to cook, Beautiful. I'm going to cook beautifully.
answer: Hey..please.. He turns. We both were not normal because we are angry and we act like we are angry with each other and we are not..I am not. I am glad to be with you. It feels comfortable to be with you. If I just left the job and never spoke with you it would have been sin. You understand?

question: Ummmmmmmmm...Yes. He stands next to her and, for want of a better physical expression, pats her on her back..She eyes him, almost critical about the lame extent of his aggression....He can't quite look at her...He pats her again.. I think I'm inventing a horrible new way of making out..
answer: Not so horrible..... His hand keeps going..he now hugs her to him even though they both still face front.. like a loving couple on a walk to the market. His hand squeezes her shoulder.

question: My hand is the only sane part of my body..every other part wants to jump off a cliff.
answer: If the other hand could cheer up, you could lift me up and carry me off. He laughs. He takes his hand from around her. It is a bit awkward.

question: I don't know how to handle that one. I think I already broke my record for smooth.
answer: I don't understand.

question: It's me. I'm not making sense. But I can get you fed. He goes to the kitchen. She begins to explore a little. She goes to a cabinet and opens it to find a CD player. She digs in her purse and takes out a CD. Nothing to be nervous about. You are not on a date... Hey, Flor? What are you doing? She enters the room...dancing a bit..
answer: Just lighting candles and picking music. Oooh. She gets up on one of the counters and sits there, her feet dangling...sings along a bit in Spanish. He is uncomfortable anew. The nervousness mounting.

question: You want a drink? She considers the question totally..He is busy cooking..not realizing how weighty she considers his question...finally aware she has not answered and looks at her.. Huh? She regards him levelly..then makes her decision.
answer: No. He gets out a bottle of vodka. I, uh...don't think you should either.

question: Then excuse me, because if I had the equipment I'd inject the vodka. He starts to pour.
answer: Wait! I think it is so important that we are each clear-headed. He looks at her..a beat...he puts the vodka away. Flor beams..we have not seen her smile like this for quite some time. It is very good that you did not ask, "why?"

question: Keep things real, right?
answer: I wouldn't have put it so well. I will remember every taste..forever.

question: Tell you the truth..I wanted a shot at cooking for you. I'm very glad you liked it.
answer: It's something watching you. He looks up at her...she has not been seen like this for a very long time, if ever.. lit up by a man.

question: Well, if it's anything at your end imagine over here...scratch that..the last thing you want to hear is somebody going off on your looks.
answer: Don't be crazy. Tell me every detail.

question: Okay, Flor, yes I will...They should name a gender after you..Looking at you doesn't do it..Staring is the only thing that makes sense..and trying not to blink so you don't miss anything. She squeals with laughter..He laughs a little himself and in so doing loses his courage..He looks down at his hands..shyness again belting him a good one..Still looking down. Look..forgive me..I'm.....It's just that you are drop-dead, crazy- gorgeous..so much so that I am really considering looking at you again before we finish up here.
answer: Soon, please. And now he looks at her. Right now....immediately..we have to dance or kiss. He stands. She stands..He kids just a bit, clowning at weighing the two options and then:

question: No contest. They kiss.
answer: You sure you're not Mexican.

question: What do you mean?
answer: I meant you talk like a Spanish song.

question: You kiss like a Spanish fly.. Joking around. I don't know what I'm talking about...
answer: Yes you do. She breaks and heads for the dining room. John has a moment to consider.. He does not have his wits about him..a condition every bit as fearsome as liberating. This song...You see what a good thing to tell you how you talk like a Mexican song. When I kiss you, entire oceans rush through my veins.. Gardens of flowers blossom in my body. He starts to make a comic gesture of awkwardness to get past the event..she shakes her head at him..driving the words -- pointing emphatically..she will not have her poetry laughed at.. And you wander along my fertile soil, picking its ripe fruit..A nightingale undresses on my tongue..And under its wings.. He laughs. She stops cold. Looks down..though just seconds long, this still constitutes the first depression of her life.

question: I'm sorry. I don't know what I just took out of you but tell me how to get it back in there..I'm sorry. Flor..I'm sorry.
answer: Then respect this. He looks at her...they kiss..It is a kiss without an author. God at the controls. They break. There is a beat then..

question: Here's something I never asked anyone..Did nightingales undress on your tongue? Flor looks at him with enormous warmth. Her arms looped around his neck..aware of the music.
answer: Did they on yours?

question: Oh, Johnny, why is everything so damn confusing?
answer: Culpa. Flor's pleasure zone is rocked. She smiles at his first Spanish word. She is wrestling with large feelings of pleasure and large ominous thoughts.

question: Is your mind racing?
answer: I would say my mind has evaporated...but that there are remnants still standing waiting to fall. It feels pretty good.

question: Like happy?
answer: Like happy.

question: You think that will last?
answer: It's already gone.

question: I understand what you mean.
answer: I don't understand what I mean.

question: That it's getting late. That responsibilities have entered your brain. Don't hide that from me. And really, one large reason we are here is because you respect me as a mother and I respect you as a father.. He is looking at her...she is disconcerted.
answer: You're a great and wild mother.

question: You are a beautiful father. She looks at him..they kiss...tenderness..heat...intimacy. When Cristina was young, I would say I want to take any man who wants me to the park and I will tell whether I want him from the way he is with Cristina. I wish you had been in the park then. Any reaction? John considering and then the answer comes to him.
answer: Exactly!..

question: You know, I always think about when you...Oh, there's no point. I talk too much... ...because I don't know if we ever talk again.
answer: Hey, hey..How do you get there? Wait.

question: Yes you do. Be honest.
answer: I'm being honest. Look at us - I think I call it honesty.

question: What are we going to do -- go home, let our hearts go back in our bodies, see each other a few more times. Make a tragedy out of us.. She kisses him again...starts to cry....looks at him..emits a small cooing sound. Ahhhhhhh. There are some mistakes you cannot risk when you have kids...Please, are you ready to go?
answer: No. I'm not. No. Stay put for a second. Stay here. Once our feet touch that floor, I'm going to get too many brain cells back. So don't be in such a hurry. That floor, Flor, is going to eat us alive. So you think it was a mistake up to now. That's rough. She nods again..trying to gut things out...but as her foot touches the floor, she must say one last thing to him.

question: Tell me again why I can't call him on the cell.
answer: Besides that he turned it off?

question: Yes.
answer: Forty messages start to look needy.

question: Mother, you're enjoying this.
answer: No..Definitely not in the way you think.

question: You are enjoying it?!?
answer: I am enjoying actually being of use to my daughter. I am enjoying the fact that I really know how to advise you and the miracle that you are so deeply disoriented that you are gobbling up everything I say. Deborah nods in agreement -- then looks at her mother in a somewhat new way..as if Evelyn were an actual person instead of an upsetting extension of herself.

question: There's one thing I'd like to say to you about you and me.
answer: You don't have to.

question: I want to.
answer: Okay.

question: You were an alcoholic and wildly promiscuous woman during my formative years so that I am in this fix because of you. It is your fault. I just needed.. ..that moment for us.
answer: You have a solid point, dear. But right now the lessons of my life are coming in handy for you.

question: There's a car coming.... Evelyn moves to her. It's him...he's got to tell me everything.. Evelyn shakes her head "no." Yes!
answer: Do you know that right now you are your own worst enemy..that you can't trust one thought in your brain?

question: Duh.
answer: Then trust me and only allow yourself to say one thing to him..One thing..."I'm so glad you're back."

question: Huh?
answer: Yes.

question: But I've got to know whether he touched her - where he touched her - how he touched her - if they broke a sweat --- what they said - who made the first move - how they left it -- if anyone loves anyone or has an intention of making contact in the future - what she wore - how he felt afterwards - whether anyone mentioned me.. ..whether they held hands when they left.. The distinct sound of a door opening and closing from downstairs.
answer: Just those words I said. If you want a prayer of coming out of this.

question: I know you're right..But..
answer: But what?

question: I forgot the sentence you said I should say.
answer: "I'm so glad you're back."

question: Okay..do I have to wait here?
answer: No..he may not come up here..go to him.

question: Why wouldn't he come up here?
answer: Just go.

question: Do I need a little makeup?
answer: You need a hose but you don't have the time. It's fine that you look like that. It's genuine..You can use genuine.

question: Thank you, mom. She takes a breath exits... I'm so glad to see you ..that you're back. John looks up at her - not knowing what to say...he is thrown. His demeanor has changed...deeper..serious..
answer: It's late, Deborah. The wrong words start to form..she stops herself..

question: Well, I just wanted to say.. what I said.. She is on the stairway..he turns to go in the opposite direction. Uhhhh.. He turns back to her...she stops herself from straying into untried words but gestures whether he is coming upstairs to bed.
answer: I can't sleep upstairs with you.. Just can't for now. This rocks her..panicked she grabs at her life preserver.

question: I'm just so glad you're back. Deborah's suddenly classy demeanor provides just the barest of footings for them...He looks at her directly for the first time since she told him.
answer: Yeah..okay. She nods..then goes back up the stairs..

question: Deb, I'm done tonight. I don't think we can jam anything else in. What's up, honey?
answer: Just thought I'd check that you were back and okay and all.

question: Because?
answer: Mom was crying for six hours straight and Grandma was in with her all that time mostly saying, "he'll be back..he'll be back." I've got to get back to Georgie.

question: I just hate that you had that kind of a night.
answer: It's good for me to worry about something that really matters instead of the stupid stuff that's usually on my mind...

question: Like?
answer: Surviving.

question: You're fantastic, Bernie...I love you.
answer: It's a slant... Hey..I know there's a lot you went through but I knew all along that Grandma was right about you coming back..I mean totally knew it so I wasn't that worried. But still I... I really appreciate it, Dad. Thanks....Stop staring at me..what? You don't know what to say?

question: Right. I don't know what to say.
answer: Just what you taught me..You're welcome.

question: I'll be in front. Upset, Cristina runs off. She kisses Bernice..and walks toward the house. As she passes under the bedroom..
answer: Please come see me. And then a crying Cristina appears on the deck. Flor glances up and keeps moving underneath the deck where she faintly hears the beginning of their exchange Please stick your head in here for a minute. Flor nods and starts up the stairs... What's with avoiding me, am I this horrible person? As Flor just looks at her. I know. It's a ridiculous question but sometimes I'm ridi...

question: No. It's a good question. A fine question. Complicated. I was just thinking to answer.
answer: Oh stop. Come on. Weren't we close?

question: No.
answer: Well, I'm very, very disappointed to hear that. It makes me feel like a fool.

question: We weren't close..but we were connected...in a bad way.
answer: You know something, I think we're saying the same thing...Look as long as we're doing closure..What did you and my husband, John, do last night? Flor pauses for less of a beat than we would have imagined.

question: I can only tell you what I did.
answer: That will be sufficient.

question: I became sure of what an incredibly lucky woman you are and I must make myself not envy you which is hard. No, it's not hard. It's impossible. Now please..I am exhausted.
answer: Same here - believe me. Deborah would hug..but it's only an eighth of a gesture because Flor has turned to exit, calling for her daughter to hurry as she goes.

question: Cristina, aprate.
answer: I was hanging out here waiting. Can't give you guys a lift? Flor shakes her head "no." She looks away for a beat so the next thing she does is a considered action. She leans forward and kisses him on the lips. John looks at her. This is killer. Incredibly hard.

question: Yes, Cari.. The gate opens and a sniffling Cristina is holding an armful of loot.
answer: Let her have it..party favors.
